3: Sickness and Health 🤕💪.Instruction: *Ask follow-up questions to dive deeper into each other’s experiences with health and wellness!* 😊
questions: How do you usually feel when you’re sick or hurt? Do you try to stay positive, or do you find it hard to cope?
What’s your go-to comfort food when you’re feeling sick? Does it actually help you feel better, or is it just comforting?
Have you ever had an experience where you avoided going to the doctor or dentist because you were scared? What finally convinced you to go, or are you still putting it off?
Some people are quick to get cosmetic surgery, even though it can be painful. How do you feel about enduring pain for beauty or self-improvement?
What’s the worst injury or sickness you’ve ever had? How did you recover, and what did you learn from that experience?
When you’re feeling mentally exhausted or stressed, what do you do to take care of yourself? Do you have any routines or activities that help you relax?
Have you ever tried any unusual or alternative methods to treat an illness or injury? Did it work for you, or was it an experiment that didn’t go as planned?
Do you think people in Korea hesitate to talk about mental health compared to physical health? Why do you think that is, and how do you think this attitude is changing?
What’s the most comforting thing someone has done for you when you were sick or hurt? How did it help you feel better, even if it was something small?
What are some things you do regularly to stay healthy and avoid getting sick? Do you think they make a big difference in your overall well-being?
